text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Local banks met on Tuesday to discuss new Central Bank measures ordering commercial banks to stop extending margin loans and to diversify guarantees required against lending for securities trading.
- Oil Minister Isa al-Mazeedi on Monday visited al-Shuaiba industrial area.
- Islamic banks operations worth $75 billion in 27 countries.
- Kuwait-Ethiopia ties strong, Kuwaiti Foreign Ministry official says at the inauguration of the first Ethiopian embassy in Kuwait.
- Kuwait Livestock Trading and Transport Co inauggurated on Tuesday a $2 million livestock carrier.
- Crown Prince and Prime Minister Sheikh Saad al-Abdulla al-Sabah to spend the summer season abroad for rest and recuperation. He left Kuwait in March after an emergency surgery.
- Kuwait holds culture day in Sweden.
- Unlicenced shops to be shut down, municipality official says.
